title: From the Beginning
description: Grew up listening to a ton of my dad's 70's music. This one has such an excellent intro, made me want to learn some guitar (still on my to-do list).

title: Octopus' Garden
description: Such an incredible band with a ton of range. Always had a soft spot for this song, its surrealism and bizarrely comforting feel.

title: Kashmir
description: Heavy, intense, badass guitar. Could have chosen any number of Led Zeppelin songs - really love some of these rock ballads from the era.

title: Roundabout
description: Kinda underrated band from the decade, and this song has such a great crescendoing intro. Another softer guitar hook that I love.

title: A Horse With No Name
description: A bit folksy and a bit out there. Love the lyrics of this one - they create such a vivid scene and mood for me every time.

title: Listen to the Music
description: A happy and feel-good rhythm, some bluesy sound. Helps me feel relaxed and hopeful.

title: Won't Get Fooled Again
description: One of the era's absolute classics. Brash in youth and rocking out - one of the most iconic ending lines.

title: Time
description: First song I remember hearing that used all kinds of different sounds. Felt otherwordly and experimental.

title: Mr. Blue Sky
description: Ecstatic, feel-good, hopping beat. So happy that the song made its way into a Guardians of the Galaxy intro with Groot.

title: Float On
description: My first true favorite song that I ‘discovered' - it was like a revelation. Heard it on the radio driving in Mayag√ºez with my cousin and it opened up a whole new world for me. So upbeat, love the bass, love the snare.

title: New Slang
description: A sort of melancholic and very sweet song. Don't know really what its words mean, but it always puts me at ease with a calm frame of my mind.

title: Starry Eyed Surprise
description: Pure nostalgia. Before vibes, this was a vibe. And yes, I first heard this song with that roller-skating beachy Coca-Cola commercial. So good.

title: I Will Follow You into the Dark
description: A sad song, but there's something strong in it, defiant and loyal. Was part of my sleep playlist for many, many years.

title: In My Heart
description: Sort of a counterbalance to Death Cab in my high school sleep playlist. This song glistens, lifts me into ethereal dreams.

title: Such Great Heights
description: Muted, repetitive and dreamy. Admire how they somehow blended this together into a floating, detached, inspiring experience.

title: Hard to Explain
description: I mean, I could've easily put the whole album here. They're raw, volatile, emotional, clever. The way the song crashes into a peak, silences... and moves on. Amazing energy.

title: Map of the Problematique
description: Muse has a sense of scale, history, composition unmatched by rock in their era. This song gathers those epic forces into a bellowing, soaring beauty.

title: Where Is My Mind?
description: This song envelopes me, moves me into a disoriented trancelike state. And it's the Fight Club crescendo? Incredible.

title: Kids
description: I've listened to this hundreds of times. It was my muttered rhythm, my heartbeat and step-count for high jump, long jump. Got me into the mindset I needed.

title: Wolf Like Me
description: A frenzy. Wild in its pitch. The drums man the drums and that fevered voice. Full volume, wondrous chaos.

title: Paper Planes
description: First heard this song in a high school pottery class and soon after, heard it immortalizd in Pineapple Express. Iconic song of the era.

title: 40 Day Dream
description: They have a raucous, uplifting energy in a bunch of songs (and some sort of Messiah complex for the frontman). Really fun to see them live!

title: Pursuit of Happiness
description: Moody, gripping, surreal. Could've (should've?) added Simple As... or Day 'N' Nite or Make Her Say. Everything was so good on that album.

title: Cryin' Smoke
description: Brings back days exploring riverside trails in the middle of the Texas summer. That delirious heat, this floaty, languishing song.

title: Going to California
description: Had to add an artist double. At this point in my life, I actually was moving to California and this song had so much peace in it. Beautiful memories.

title: Future Primitive
description: A primal drum, a guiding bass. Sometimes, simplicity says the most. I step outside myself anytime I really listen to this song.

title: Rawnald Gregory Erickson the Second
description: Another bass-song perfect for zoning out, relaxing in this wonderful mood. Does it make any sense? No. Does it need to? Also no :)

title: Twenty Two
description: I'm not heavily into lyrics as the driving connection to my songs. So to my blurry mind, this song is as happy and carefree as anything in the list. Beautiful whistling here too.

title: Santa Maria de Feira
description: A very romantic and peaceful song. Like drawing yourself a forest bath. Immerse yourself in the calm.

title: Always Like This
description: Strong into my indie phase (maybe never left it?), I liked mostly everything by this band. Somehow can't get enough of British bands' sensibility.

title: Bright Whites
description: What a very weird and experimental man with a mesmerizing violin. His music is all over the map and seeing him looping live was a trip.

title: Bad Things
description: There was this brief pinnacle of the intersection of rap + indie (see also Chance's Yolo sampling Santigold). This is one of the best in the genre.

title: Pastures of Plenty
description: An American icon. I'm enthralled by folk music across cultures, the mythology, the lyrics. ‘Always we ramble, that river and I...'

title: Everybody's Something
description: Acid Rap is an album worth the full listen, repeat, repeat, ad infinitum. Does anyone have more fun with language than Chance? Incredible wordplay.

title: Heart it Races
description: The only other contender to be my favorite song. I can live in the drums, the bass, the raw sound, the off-kilter lyrics. It's a hazy, wild sort of energy that I love to inhabit.

title: Me Voy Pa'l Pueblo
description: Una canci√≥n que Abuelo sol√≠a silbar y tararear. Era de Yabucoa, conoc√≠a la vida y la m√∫sica de los j√≠baros. Una hermosa canci√≥n.

title: Chum
description: Rich piano, rich metaphor - feels like a heavy confessional. Hadn't heard anything like this before and haven't heard anything like it since.
Badass, spiky, irreverent. Utterly unique rap and the music video is hilarious with that Mickey Mouse sweater.

title: El Caballo Pelotero
description: Es una canci√≥n loquita, llena de tonterias. Me encanta eso y el ritmo es El Gran Combo cl√°sico: un estilo de salsa bi√©n energ√©tico.

title: Doses & Mimosas
description: The sound is airy, sublime even. Almost lulls you into forgetting this a song for haters, by haters. Purpose built for the brashest times in your life.

title: Unlucky Skin
description: Feels like the banjo is weaving some sort of riddle that the song is trying to answer. There's a world in there I can't quite escape.

title: Riptide
description: A gorgeous song sung with a melancholic depth of love. My wife and I love singing it together. Also, for about the first 10 years of owning an ukulele, this was the only song I could play.

title: Let's Get Lost
description: I guess G-Eazy is a decent rapper, but his songs are easily at their best when they're collabs. Love the juxtaposition of Devon Baldwin's voice with the muffled beat and detached rap.

title: Dance Yrself Clean
description: Somehow I'll never know exactly what the lyrics are at each point of this nearly nine-minute-long song. All I know is that by the end I feel so free. It's an ecstatic experience - a nighttime highway riding to the beach, windows down. Also, this urban ski video - perfection.

title: Grown Up
description: An uplifting song with happy chords - carries some nostalgia of running around as little kids, dreaming of some incredible future.

title: Balance
description: If you ever need a reason to care about humans making music, go see this frontman perform. It will cure anything that ails you - such powerful, honest energy and emotion.

title: You Sexy Thing
description: The funkiest, sexiest song out there. This was the song for my wife and I's first dance - such a happy vibe!

title: Sunflower
description: The best song in an unbelievably, ground-breakingly good movie about a Puerto Rican Spiderman? Yes, please.

title: Diva
description: Started getting into some more lo-fi, but then found an upbeat offshot of sampled voice and rhythm. Violin here mixes so, so well.

title: Broccoli
description: Some music is just plain fun. And for whatever reason, this song just feels so light-hearted and loose. Great chorus.

title: Side of the Road
description: Set the mood for a lot of late night train commutes. Has this expanisve intensity and unintelligible meaning. Kicked off some excellent poetic escapades for me.

title: Go To Town
description: Another one - so witty, fun catchy. Doja Cat is a master lyricist with such a flowing, versatile voice. Wraps you up in the melody.

title: Norf Norf
description: From the opening, the is the best kind of strange. The hollow, concrete, prolonged blaring follows the flow and jaunty overlaid beat. Hypnotic.

title: YES!
description: Blended sort of guitar riff with the most confident rap. Feel it, live it for a minute. Enjoy it, play it again. Yes!

title: Hollow Life
description: Very West coast, hipster, beachy, slacker. Somehow they mixed the apathy, beauty, and yearning into a really beautiful song.

title: Sometimes
description: His music speaks so well to the parts of me that want to hike, camp, follow paths to the oceans and rivers. Really puts me into a dreamy, imaginative trance.

title: DTmF
description: A longtime holdout, Bad Bunny finally won me over. Este √°lbum tiene todo que ver con lo que significa ser boricua. Los ritmos, los tambores, la plena - lleno de nostalgia y belleza.
